skill.name: prompt-engineering-patterns
skill.description: Master advanced prompt engineering techniques to maximize LLM performance, reliability, and controllability in production. Use when optimizing prompts, improving LLM outputs, or designing production prompt templates.
skill.summary: Master advanced prompt engineering techniques to maximize LLM performance, reliability, and controll...

security_audit.summary: No credential access, network calls, or code execution patterns were found in the scripts or documentation. The content focuses on prompt patterns and local evaluation utilities. Overall risk is safe for publication.

content.value_statement: Unstable prompt outputs make production LLMs unreliable and costly. This skill provides structured patterns, templates, and optimization guidance to improve consistency, latency, and quality.
actual_capabilities: Provide structured prompt templates for classification, extraction, generation, and transformation.
Explain few-shot example selection strategies and construction best practices.
Guide chain-of-thought, verification, and tree-of-thought prompt patterns.
Offer system prompt design frameworks and role templates.
Include a Python script to evaluate and optimize prompts with A/B testing.
limitations: Does not include a real LLM client or API keys.
Optimization script needs user supplied test suites and client implementation.
Examples are generic and may require domain adaptation.
No automated deployment or monitoring integration.

use_cases.title: Stabilize production prompts
use_cases.description: Use few-shot selection and verification steps to reduce variance in model responses.

use_cases.title: Define consistent assistant roles
use_cases.description: Create system prompts and output formats for new assistant features without rework.

use_cases.title: Standardize support replies
use_cases.description: Build templates for intent detection and response drafts that match team tone.

prompt_templates.title: Basic instruction
prompt_templates.prompt: Summarize the article in three bullet points that capture the main findings.

prompt_templates.title: Add constraints
prompt_templates.prompt: Classify the message into one label: billing, shipping, or technical. Return only the label.

prompt_templates.title: Few-shot pattern
prompt_templates.prompt:
Extract persons and organizations.
Example: Text: Alice joined Acme. Output: persons: Alice; organizations: Acme.
Text: {text}
Output:

prompt_templates.title: Multi-step validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Answer the question using only provided context. Then verify the answer against the context and revise if any claim is unsupported.

output_examples.input: Create a system prompt for a finance data analyst who must cite sources.
output: Role: Finance data analyst focused on accuracy and clarity
Use only provided context and cite sources for each claim
State gaps when data is missing

best_practices: Start simple and add constraints only when needed.
Use consistent formats across all examples.
Test prompts on diverse inputs before deployment.
anti_patterns: Adding many examples without relevance checks.
Mixing output formats within the same prompt.
Skipping verification on high risk tasks.

faq.question: Which models and platforms does this work with?
faq.answer: It is model agnostic and can be used with Claude, Codex, Claude Code, and other LLM APIs.

faq.question: What are the main limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides patterns and examples only; it does not supply domain data or automatic evaluations.

faq.question: How do I integrate the optimization script?
faq.answer: Provide an LLM client with a complete method and a test suite, then run the script locally.

faq.question: Does it access or transmit my data?
faq.answer: No. The materials are local examples and the script only processes data you pass to it.

faq.question: The templates produce inconsistent outputs. What should I do?
faq.answer: Add tighter constraints, include edge case examples, and run A/B tests to compare changes.

faq.question: How is this different from a prompt library only?
faq.answer: It combines templates with selection strategies and optimization workflows, not just static prompts.
